context: Major utility company facing aging infrastructure and increasing renewable energy integration demands, requiring significant capital investment in grid modernization

request.purpose: Grid modernization including smart meters, advanced distribution management systems, and renewable energy integration infrastructure
request.justification: Address 40-year-old infrastructure, improve reliability from current 99.2% to 99.9%, enable 50% renewable energy integration by 2030

decision_process.outcome: Feasibility confirmed with projected 15% ROI over 20 years
Strong stakeholder support with regulatory approval secured
Funding secured through combination of bonds, rate increases, and federal grants
Approved with phased implementation over 5 years

business_impact.expected_outcome: Improved grid reliability, reduced outage duration by 60%, enabled renewable energy growth

lessons_learned: Early stakeholder engagement critical for large infrastructure projects, comprehensive risk assessment essential for regulatory approval, phased implementation reduces execution risk
